ComicInfo.Summary:
A Cry in the Night: Horst has another person pose as a "wild boy of the forest" to kill the Baron so he can marry Marie.
Schocker: Criminal Jim Laskey is judged by a ghostly jury after he gunned down Officer Ryan.
The Creature That Never Existed!: Just as Professor Miles is about to present his evidence that the Quoquarto beast is merely a legend, the beast appears from nowhere and attacks him.
The Telltale Hand!: George Karyl kills his client John Putnam and hides the body but the lines on his palm begin to form a hangman's noose.
I Was Blackmailed by a Phantom: A ghost helps lead Santos's army to overthrow the dictator of his country but afterwards tries to blackmail Santos into trading places.
Frozen in Fear: A cemetery watchmen is attacked by two criminals but the ghosts of the cemetery come to his aid.
The Swami of Broadway: Dean Hall and Orry Kane are on a trip in Bengal. Kane tries again to persuade Hall to sell him his theater, Hall again refuses. They enter a village and see a swami who predicts an elephant stampede. The square is emptied just in time. A month later Hall auditions acts for his theater when the swami appears on stage. He makes two predictions which comes true. Later the swami is asked to appear at the theater and he says he will not enter as it will be struck by a meteor. Hall sells the theatre to Kane and leaves. The swami is then revealed to be a fake. Then a meteor hits the theatre.
The Rainbow Man: Dr. Hargate discovers how chameleons change color and gives himself the same abilities in order to commit crimes. But he doesn't realize he has a color-blind neighbor who can spot him.
The Night I Watched Myself Die!: A hired killer is after reporter Paul Galen.
The Demon Gun!: Jim Folson believes that big game hunter John Ellis has a magical gun that never misses.
The Strange Experiment of Dr. Grimm!: John Grimm keeps a convicted murderer's brain alive after his execution but finds himself controlled by the brain to commit murder.
Who's That Lying in My Coffin?: A couple has shared dreams about one of them dying.
ComicInfo.Writer: Carl Wessler,George Kashdan,Jerry Grandenetti,Sam Meade,Sam Meade,Jerry Grandenetti,George Kashdan,Carl Wessler
